page.title: 05The Dig on the School Field
page.content: {The Headland-H/pool By Chautal Lax } In 1983 some archaeologists came to our school.They told us that they thought that the{Medieval Town Wall of {Hartlepool}was underneath St.Helen's School Field.Later they came and dug up the field and the first things that they found were bits of{Victorian {pottery and pipes.}Later they did find bits of the Medieval Wall.There was another'dig' on the headland-this one was on the site of the old{Henry {Smith's School.}Traces were found of the{Old Friary Church}built in 1240 by the Franciscans.The monks had made a promise to be very poor and they spent their lives looking after the sick. There are now modern houses built on this sight.I found out about this in the cabin at the{Church Close}'dig'.
